Name: Complete Blood Count (CBC) (Blood Test) at Chughtai Lab
Short description: What is the Complete Blood Count (CBC) Test? The CBC test in Pakistan is a commonly ordered blood test in Pakistan. This test provides important information about a person's overall health by measuring different components of their blood, including red and white blood cells, haemoglobin, and platelets. A CBC or Complete Blood Count is a test that evaluates various health factors. It is not only a primary health indicator but also indicates different types of abnormalities like Leukemia, Infections, various deficiencies, and anemia. Generally, it shows the ranges of various blood components that gives an overview of health. CBC is also one of the most common tests. A health care worker will ask you to fold up your sleeves to a point when your elbow is naked. Then at the bend of the elbow, a blood sample will be taken followed by a patch of band aid at the site where the needle was injected. When is a CBC Performed? CBC is an overall indicator of health. Following are times when it is performed. It is performed after every two days or even daily when someone has dengue to check the platelets count. It is used to check for infection. If you have been feeling weak, lethargic, or dizzy, then your physician might suggest a CBC. If there is evident Inflammation, bruising, or bleeding, then get a CBC test done. With liver-function-test, doctors also suggest a CBC. A CBC is also recommended before an Endoscopy . CBC test is suggested alongside the following tests: I.semon analysis II.beta-HCG III.lipid-profile IV.anti-HIV V.usg-anomaly-scan What Does a CBC Detect? The followings are the list of things that a CBC measures normally. Infection Low platelets Count Inflammation Cause of a recurring infection Anemia Leukemia If there is a formal test, then other things will also be checked, but these things are detected in a standard test in all labs. When Should I know the Results of the Test? You can get results of a CBC test within a couple of hours. If the lab from where you got your test done sends off its sample to some other facility then it might take a day. You will receive a text message or an email that your results are ready. Complete Blood Count (CBC) Test Results Range? Here are the normal ranges of CBC test. 1.Red blood cell count a.For Males: 4.35-5.65 trillion cells/L b.For Females: 3.92-5.13 trillion cells/L 2.Hemoglobin a.For Males: 13.2-16.6 grams/dL or 132-166 grams/L b.For Females: 11.6-15 grams/dL or 116-150 grams/L 3.Hematocrit a.For Males: 38.3-48.6 percent b.For Females: 35.5-44.9 percent 4.White blood cell count For both males and females, it is 3.4-9.6 billion cells/L or 3,400 to 9,600 cells/mcL. 5.Platelet count a.For Males: 135-317 billion/L or 135,000 to 317,000/mcL b.For Females: 157-371 billion/L or 157,000 to 371,000/mcL What are the Benefits of this Test? There are multiple benefits of a CBC test some of them are as follows. You will get to know if all of your blood components are in the normal range or not. It will give you an idea if you have any deficiencies or toxicities. When you get an overview of what the problem is and where the problem lies, you will handle it easily. If there is an infection that has not yet shown its signs and symptoms, you will be able to catch it early if you regularly get your CBC test done.
Description: Known as: CBC, Blood For Analysis, Blood CP, Blood Complete Picture, Blood Routine Examination,Blood C/E Complete

Name: Potassium (24 Hours Urine) (at Chughtai Lab)
Short description: This test measures the amount of potassium excreted in urine over a 24-hour period. It helps in assessing kidney function, electrolyte balance, and conditions such as high blood pressure, adrenal gland disorders, and dehydration. Collecting urine for 24 hours provides a more accurate assessment compared to a single sample.
Description: 4-hour urine test for potassium measurement.

Name: Potassium (Spot Urine) (at Chughtai Lab)
Short description: This test measures potassium levels in a random (spot) urine sample. It helps evaluate electrolyte balance, kidney function, and conditions such as hypertension, dehydration, or adrenal gland disorders. Unlike the 24-hour test, this provides a quick assessment of potassium excretion from the body.
Description: Spot urine test for potassium levels.

Name: Pre-Diabetes Profile (at Chughtai Lab)
Short description: A combined blood test panel to detect early changes in glucose control and metabolic risk before diabetes develops. It typically includes markers such as fasting glucose and HbA1c (and may include supporting tests like a lipid profile/others; components can vary by lab). Helpful for people with risk factors like family history, overweight, or sedentary lifestyle to guide timely lifestyle and treatment decisions.
Description: Early screening panel for risk of diabetes

Name: Pre-Marital Profile (at Chughtai Lab)
Short description: This profile is designed for couples planning marriage. It includes essential blood and health tests to detect conditions such as thalassemia carrier status, hepatitis, HIV, and other infections, ensuring both partners are healthy and safe before starting a family. The report is usually delivered after one day.
Description: Comprehensive health screening before marriage.

Name: Pregnancy Test (Urine) (at Chughtai Lab)
Short description: This urine test detects the presence of the pregnancy hormone hCG (human chorionic gonadotropin) . It provides a quick and reliable confirmation of pregnancy using a random/spot urine sample. Results are available the same day, making it a convenient option for early pregnancy detection.
Description: Urine test for pregnancy detection

Name: Prenatal Profile (at Chughtai Lab)
Short description: This prenatal profile is a complete set of tests recommended during pregnancy to monitor the mother’s health and the baby’s development. It typically includes blood tests (2 EDTA, 2 clotted samples, fluoride tube) and spot urine analysis. The profile helps detect anemia, infections, gestational diabetes, and other pregnancy-related complications. Results are usually available the next day .
Description: Comprehensive screening profile for expecting mothers.

Name: Prevenar-13 (Pneumococcal) (at Chughtai Lab)
Short description: Prevenar-13 is a pneumococcal conjugate vaccine that protects against 13 types of Streptococcus pneumoniae bacteria. It helps prevent serious infections such as pneumonia, meningitis, and bloodstream infections. Recommended for infants, young children, elderly individuals, and people with weak immune systems. The vaccine is administered as an injection and is available daily.
Description: Pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (PCV13) for infection prevention

Name: Potassium (Spot Urine) (at Chughtai Lab) (Copy)
Short description: This test measures potassium levels in a random (spot) urine sample. It helps evaluate electrolyte balance, kidney function, and conditions such as hypertension, dehydration, or adrenal gland disorders. Unlike the 24-hour test, this provides a quick assessment of potassium excretion from the body.
Description: Spot urine test for potassium levels.

Name: Prospera Test (Outsource – Natera) (at Chughtai Lab)
Short description: The Prospera Test by Natera is an advanced, non-invasive genetic test designed for transplant patients. It measures donor-derived cell-free DNA (dd-cfDNA) in the recipient’s blood to detect early signs of organ rejection, reducing the need for invasive biopsies. This highly specialized test is outsourced to Natera and results are typically available after two weeks .
Description: Advanced genetic test for organ transplant monitoring.

Name: Protein (CSF) (at Chughtai Lab)
Short description: This test measures the concentration of protein in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF), which surrounds the brain and spinal cord. Elevated or decreased protein levels can help diagnose conditions such as meningitis, multiple sclerosis, brain tumors, and other central nervous system disorders. The sample is obtained via lumbar puncture, and results are available the same day.
Description: Protein level measurement in cerebrospinal fluid (CSF).

Name: Potassium (Spot Urine) (at Chughtai Lab) (Copy)
Short description: This test measures potassium levels in a random (spot) urine sample. It helps evaluate electrolyte balance, kidney function, and conditions such as hypertension, dehydration, or adrenal gland disorders. Unlike the 24-hour test, this provides a quick assessment of potassium excretion from the body.
Description: Spot urine test for potassium levels.

Name: Protein (Fluid) (at Chughtai Lab)
Short description: This test measures the protein concentration in different body fluids (other than blood), such as pleural fluid, ascitic fluid, or peritoneal fluid. It helps in diagnosing infections, inflammation, liver disease, kidney disorders, and other fluid-related abnormalities. The test provides valuable insight into the cause of fluid buildup in the body. Results are available the same day.
Description: Protein level measurement in body fluids.

Name: Protein (Spot Urine) (at Chughtai Lab)
Short description: This test measures potassium levels in a random (spot) urine sample. It helps evaluate electrolyte balance, kidney function, and conditions such as hypertension, dehydration, or adrenal gland disorders. Unlike the 24-hour test, this provides a quick assessment of potassium excretion from the body.
Description: Protein level measurement in a random urine sample

Name: Protein C (at Chughtai Lab)
Short description: Protein C is a natural anticoagulant (blood thinner) that helps prevent abnormal clot formation. This test measures the activity or level of Protein C in the blood, using a sodium citrate (PT) vial sample. It is especially useful in diagnosing inherited or acquired clotting disorders, deep vein thrombosis (DVT), or unexplained blood clots.
Description: Blood test to measure Protein C activity and deficiency.

Name: Potassium (Spot Urine) (at Chughtai Lab) (Copy)
Short description: This test measures potassium levels in a random (spot) urine sample. It helps evaluate electrolyte balance, kidney function, and conditions such as hypertension, dehydration, or adrenal gland disorders. Unlike the 24-hour test, this provides a quick assessment of potassium excretion from the body.

Name: Protein Electrophoresis (Serum) (at Chughtai Lab)
Short description: This test separates and measures different types of proteins in the blood using electrophoresis. It helps diagnose and monitor conditions such as multiple myeloma, liver disease, kidney disorders, and immune system abnormalities. The sample required is 3–5cc clotted blood or serum .
Description: Serum protein separation and analysis test.

Name: Protein/Creatinine Ratio (Spot Urine) (at Chughtai Lab)
Short description: This test measures the ratio of protein to creatinine in a random (spot) urine sample. It is commonly used to detect and monitor proteinuria , which may indicate kidney disease, diabetes, or hypertension-related kidney damage. The ratio provides a reliable alternative to a 24-hour urine protein test. Results are available the same day.
Description: Spot urine test for protein-to-creatinine ratio.

Name: Potassium (Spot Urine) (at Chughtai Lab) (Copy)
Short description: This test measures potassium levels in a random (spot) urine sample. Unlike the 24-hour test, this provides a quick assessment of potassium excretion from the body.
Description: Spot urine test for potassium levels.

Name: Prothrombin Time (PT with INR) (at Chughtai Lab)
Short description: his test measures Prothrombin Time (PT) and the International Normalized Ratio (INR) to evaluate how quickly blood clots. It is especially useful for patients taking anticoagulant medications (e.g., Warfarin), and for diagnosing bleeding disorders, liver disease, or Vitamin K deficiency. The sample is collected in a sodium citrate (PT) vial , and results are available the same day.
Description: Blood clotting time and INR measurement.

Name: PRP (If Less than 10cc) (Home Care) (at Chughtai Lab)
Short description: This service involves preparing Platelet-Rich Plasma (PRP) from a small blood sample (less than 10cc) at the patient’s home. PRP is commonly used in therapies for skin rejuvenation, hair restoration, wound healing, and orthopedic treatments. The procedure is performed on call by trained healthcare professionals, ensuring convenience and safety for patients.
Description: Platelet-Rich Plasma (PRP) preparation under 10cc at home.

Name: PRP (If More than 10cc) (Home Care) (at Chughtai Lab)
Short description: This service involves preparing Platelet-Rich Plasma (PRP) from a larger blood sample (more than 10cc) at the patient’s home. PRP therapy is widely used for skin rejuvenation, hair loss treatment, wound healing, and orthopedic care . The procedure is performed on call by professional healthcare staff, ensuring convenience and medical safety.
Description: Platelet-Rich Plasma (PRP) preparation over 10cc at home.

Name: PRP (Platelet Rich Plasma) Treatment – Face (at Chughtai Lab)
Short description: This treatment uses Platelet-Rich Plasma (PRP) , prepared from the patient’s own blood, and applied/injected into the facial skin. It stimulates natural collagen production, improves skin texture, reduces fine lines, and enhances overall glow. Known as the "vampire facial," this is a safe and natural method for anti-aging and skin rejuvenation, performed by trained professionals.
Description: PRP therapy for skin rejuvenation of the face.

Name: PRP (Platelet Rich Plasma) Treatment – Face (at Chughtai Lab)
Short description: This treatment uses Platelet-Rich Plasma (PRP) derived from the patient’s own blood, applied/injected into the facial skin. It stimulates collagen production, reduces wrinkles and fine lines, improves skin tone, and restores a youthful glow. Often referred to as the "vampire facial," this is a safe and natural procedure for anti-aging and skin rejuvenation. 📅 Availability: Daily ⏳ Reporting Time: Next Day

Name: PRP (Platelet Rich Plasma) Treatment – Scalp (at Chughtai Lab)

It stimulates hair follicles, promotes natural hair growth, strengthens existing hair, and improves scalp health. PRP is a safe and effective solution for hair thinning and early-stage baldness . 📅 Availability: Daily ⏳ Reporting Time: Next Day

Name: PRP (Platelet Rich Plasma) – Only for National (at Chughtai Lab)

The procedure is performed on call to ensure timely service and medical convenience. 📅 Availability: On Call ⏳ Reporting Time: Daily

Name: Psycho Therapy (Home Care) (at Chughtai Lab)
Short description: This service provides psychotherapy sessions at the patient’s home by qualified mental health professionals. It is designed to address mental health issues such as stress, anxiety, depression, trauma, and behavioral challenges. Home-based therapy ensures comfort, privacy, and convenience , allowing patients to receive treatment in a familiar environment. 📅 Availability: Daily ⏳ Reporting Time: Same Day
Description: Professional psychotherapy sessions at home.

Name: Pulmonologist Consultation (at Chughtai Lab)
Short description: This service provides consultation with an experienced Pulmonologist , a specialist in diagnosing and treating lung and respiratory conditions. It covers diseases such as asthma, chronic cough, bronchitis, COPD, lung infections, tuberculosis, and sleep apnea . The consultation includes medical history review, symptom assessment, and treatment guidance. 📅 Availability: Daily ⏳ Reporting Time: Same Day
Description: Specialist consultation for lung and respiratory diseases.

Name: Pure Tone Audiometry (PTA) – Audiology (at Chughtai Lab)
Short description: Pure Tone Audiometry (PTA) is a standard hearing test that measures a person’s ability to hear different sound frequencies and intensities. It is widely used to diagnose hearing loss, ear disorders, and to assess the need for hearing aids . The test is painless, quick, and performed by trained audiologists. 📅 Availability: Daily ⏳ Reporting Time: Same Day
Description: Hearing test to measure hearing thresholds.

Name: Pure Tone Audiometry (PTA) & Tympanometry (at Chughtai Lab)
Short description: This test includes Pure Tone Audiometry (PTA) to measure hearing thresholds and Tympanometry to evaluate middle ear function. It helps in diagnosing hearing loss, fluid in the middle ear, eardrum mobility, and Eustachian tube dysfunction . The procedure is simple, non-invasive, and performed by trained audiologists. 📅 Availability: Daily ⏳ Reporting Time: Same Day
Description: Combined hearing and middle ear function test.

Name: Pus Swab for AFB Smear/ZN Stain (at Chughtai Lab)
Short description: This test examines a pus swab for the presence of Acid-Fast Bacilli (AFB) using the Ziehl-Neelsen (ZN) stain technique . It is primarily used to detect tuberculosis (TB) and other mycobacterial infections . The test is quick, reliable, and helps in diagnosing infections in patients with pus discharge from wounds or abscesses. 📅 Sample Required: Pus Swab 📅 Availability: Daily ⏳ Reporting Time: Same Day
Description: Test for tuberculosis bacteria in pus samples.

Name: Pus Swab for Bacterial C/S (Aerobic) with Sensitivity (at Chughtai Lab)
Short description: This test involves taking a pus swab to perform bacterial culture and sensitivity (C/S) under aerobic conditions . It identifies the specific bacteria causing the infection and determines which antibiotics will be most effective against it. This test is essential for patients with persistent wounds, abscesses, or infections that are not responding to treatment. 📅 Sample Required: Pus Swab 📅 Availability: Daily ⏳ Reporting Time: After Three Days
Description: Culture and sensitivity test for bacterial infection in pus samples.

Name: Pus Swab for Fungus C/S with Fungal Staining (at Chughtai Lab)
Short description: This test examines a pus swab for fungal growth using culture and fungal staining techniques . It helps detect superficial and deep fungal infections in wounds, abscesses, or chronic pus discharges. The test also determines the type of fungus, which guides targeted antifungal treatment. 📅 Sample Required: Pus Swab 📅 Availability: Daily ⏳ Reporting Time: After Four Weeks
Description: Culture and staining test for fungal infection in pus samples.

Name: Pus Swab for Fungus Stain / Fungal Smear (at Chughtai Lab)
Short description: This test uses a pus swab sample to check for the presence of fungal elements under a microscope through staining/smear techniques. It is a quick diagnostic method for detecting fungal infections in wounds, abscesses, or chronic pus discharges. Early detection helps in starting appropriate antifungal therapy. 📅 Sample Required: Pus Swab 📅 Availability: Daily ⏳ Reporting Time: Same Day
Description: Microscopic examination of pus swab for fungal elements.

Name: Pus Swab for Gram Stain (at Chughtai Lab)
Short description: This test uses a pus swab sample to perform a Gram stain , which helps classify bacteria into Gram-positive or Gram-negative groups. It is a rapid diagnostic tool for identifying bacterial infections in wounds, abscesses, or pus discharges, and guides doctors in selecting appropriate antibiotics. 📅 Sample Required: Pus Swab 📅 Availability: Daily ⏳ Reporting Time: Same Day
Description: Microscopic test to detect bacteria in pus samples.

Name: Pus Syringe for AFB Smear / ZN Stain (at Chughtai Lab)
Short description: This test examines a pus sample collected in a syringe for the presence of Acid-Fast Bacilli (AFB) using the Ziehl-Neelsen (ZN) stain . It is primarily used to diagnose tuberculosis (TB) and other mycobacterial infections. The test provides quick results and helps in early treatment planning. 📅 Sample Required: Pus (Syringe) 📅 Availability: Daily ⏳ Reporting Time: Same Day
Description: Test to detect tuberculosis bacteria in pus samples.

Name: Pus Syringe for Bacterial C/S (Aerobic) with Sensitivity (at Chughtai Lab)
Short description: This test involves taking a pus sample in a syringe to perform bacterial culture and sensitivity (C/S) under aerobic conditions . It identifies the bacteria causing the infection and determines which antibiotics are most effective for treatment. It is especially useful for patients with chronic infections, abscesses, or non-healing wounds . 📅 Sample Required: Pus (Syringe) 📅 Availability: Daily ⏳ Reporting Time: After Three Days
Description: Culture and sensitivity test for bacterial infection in pus (syringe sample).

Name: Pus Syringe for Fungus C/S with Fungal Staining (at Chughtai Lab)
Short description: This test uses a pus sample collected in a syringe to check for fungal infections through culture and fungal staining . It helps in detecting superficial and deep fungal infections that may affect wounds, abscesses, or chronic discharges. Results guide doctors in starting the correct antifungal treatment . 📅 Sample Required: Pus (Syringe) 📅 Availability: Daily ⏳ Reporting Time: After Four Weeks
Description: Fungal culture and staining test for pus (syringe sample).

Name: Pus Syringe for Fungus Stain / Fungal Smear (at Chughtai Lab)
Short description: This test examines a pus sample collected in a syringe for the presence of fungal elements using staining/smear techniques. It is a rapid diagnostic method for detecting fungal infections in patients with chronic wounds, abscesses, or pus discharges . Early detection helps in timely antifungal therapy . 📅 Sample Required: Pus (Syringe) 📅 Availability: Daily ⏳ Reporting Time: Next Day
Description: Microscopic test for fungal elements in pus (syringe sample).

Name: Pus Syringe for Gram Stain (at Chughtai Lab)
Short description: This test examines a pus sample collected in a syringe using the Gram stain technique , which helps differentiate bacteria into Gram-positive and Gram-negative groups. It provides a quick initial diagnosis of bacterial infections in wounds, abscesses, or chronic pus discharges, helping doctors choose suitable antibiotics. 📅 Sample Required: Pus (Syringe) 📅 Availability: Daily ⏳ Reporting Time: Same Day
Description: Microscopic test to identify bacteria in pus (syringe sample).

Name: Qualitative Cannabinoids in Urine (at Chughtai Lab)
Short description: This test detects the presence of cannabinoids (marijuana/THC and related compounds) in urine. It is a qualitative test , meaning it confirms whether cannabinoids are present or not, without measuring the exact quantity. It is often used for drug screening, clinical evaluation, or monitoring substance abuse . 📅 Sample Required: Urine 📅 Availability: Daily ⏳ Reporting Time: After Two Weeks
Description: Screening test for detection of cannabinoids in urine.

Name: Qualitative Confirmation of Amitriptyline (TCA) (at Chughtai Lab)
Short description: This test provides a qualitative confirmation of Amitriptyline , a tricyclic antidepressant (TCA), in the body. It helps in drug monitoring, overdose detection, and compliance verification for patients under psychiatric or neurological treatment. It is particularly useful in cases of suspected drug toxicity or misuse . 📅 Sample Required: Blood/Urine (as advised) 📅 Availability: Daily ⏳ Reporting Time: After Two Weeks
Description: Test to confirm the presence of Amitriptyline (TCA) in the body.

Name: Qualitative Confirmation of Opiates and Cocaine (at Chughtai Lab)
Short description: This test provides a qualitative confirmation for the presence of opiates and cocaine in a patient’s system. It is widely used for drug abuse screening, clinical assessment, and medico-legal purposes . The test helps doctors and authorities confirm whether a person has consumed cocaine or opiate-based drugs . 📅 Sample Required: Blood/Urine (as advised) 📅 Availability: Daily ⏳ Reporting Time: After Two Weeks
Description: Screening test for detecting opiates and cocaine in the body.

Name: Qualitative Confirmation of Opiates and Cocaine (at Chughtai Lab)
Short description: This test provides a qualitative confirmation for opiates and cocaine , two commonly misused substances. It is highly useful for drug abuse screening, toxicology investigations, medico-legal cases, and patient monitoring . The test confirms the presence or absence of these drugs, ensuring reliable results for clinical or legal purposes. 📅 Sample Required: Blood/Urine (as advised) 📅 Availability: Daily ⏳ Reporting Time: After Two Weeks
Description: Test to confirm the presence of opiates and cocaine in the body.
